definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to assess one's capabilities and act accordingly (idiom); to act within one's competence/One does what one can.
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth

sentences.english: Aid to living according to our capability, step-by-step, and gradually increase.
sentences.chinese: 生活救助要量力而行，循序漸進，逐步提高。

sentences.english: I have a back overconfident , but also to do a study of these studies .
sentences.chinese: 我也不自量力一回，也對這些研究做一番研究。

sentences.english: He overreached himself in trying to get the manager's job.
sentences.chinese: 他不自量力想謀求經理職位，但沒成功。

sentences.english: A mountain rivers for their discontent worth beefing up, give him Too Big for Her Skin.
sentences.chinese: 百川不滿一山爲自己催谷身價，大罵他不自量力。

sentences.english: Any users of credit may overextend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 每個貸款使用者都有可能作出不自量力的事。

sentences.english: I'm not going to flatter myself by assuming these cameras are for me.
sentences.chinese: 我不打算自不量力假設這些相機是專門爲我準備。

sentences.english: He Yun remind clock from, no matter with whom to begin, dont overreach.
sentences.chinese: 何芸提醒鍾離，不管跟誰要動手，別不自量力。

sentences.english: When she said she would do the job I think she bit off more than she could chew.
sentences.chinese: 當她說她將要做這份工作時，我想她是自不量力。

sentences.english: Don's overstretch your start-up in times of family upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭遭受鉅變時，創業要講究量力而爲。

sentences.english: Ability to be ahead of schedule owing on the loan, there is room for the hands of residents.
sentences.chinese: 提前還貸應量力而爲，適合手中有閒錢的居民。

sentences.english: Many card holders who don't know their limits get into debts over their heads.
sentences.chinese: 許多持卡人自不量力，讓卡債逼上絕路。

sentences.english: We didn't have enough to get by.
sentences.chinese: 別太自不量力了，你還有很多要學。

definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
not take a proper measure of oneself/to overrate one's own abilities
to know shame/to feel shame (often with a negative, shameless)
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
